title: Graph of velocity which ship has engine on

content.description: Two identical spaceships are traveling in deep space, far from any planets or stars. The ships travel in the same direction, with the slower one directly behind the faster one. The ships are connected by a cable attached to a spool, so that the part of the cable outside the ships can be made longer or shorter as needed. The cable is used to bring the ships to the same speed for a transfer of cargo. The graph above shows the speed of the two ships during a 10 s interval.
content.question: Does at least one of the ships have its engine turned on during the time interval shown, and what evidence indicates so?

choices.label: Yes, because Ship 2 is speeding up.
Yes, because the momentum of the two-rocket system increases.
Yes, because an engine is needed to keep the system moving.
No, because the cable alone could be responsible for making Ship 1 slow down and Ship 2 speed up.

content.answer: Yes, because the momentum of the two-rocket system increases.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
